sub_title: Data Science  | Artificial Intelligence | Machine Learning | Big Data | Quantitative Marketing
summary:
I am a Data Scientist/Machine Learning enthusiast with a Master's degree in Econometrics with a Specialization in Business Analytics & Quantitative Marketing at Erasmus University Rotterdam and a Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering (Sao Paulo State University - UNESP/ 9TH Best University of Latin America).

▶️ A ​little about me:
I am originally from Brazil, where I spent most of my life. But because I have European grandparents, I am also a European citizen, which allows me to live and work here.

I finished my Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering in 2014 and concluded that to not miss the human touch as an engineer (at least in Brazil), I decided to work for DIA, a global supermarket chain strong in Spain/Portugal and the Latin American world. I have been employed there as a Private Label Product Manager, where I managed the supply chain for bakery products and built reports that the head office used for analysis. 

While I love Brazil, almost four years ago, I decided it was time for a change and moved to Europe. After reflecting on my drivers and ambitions, I decided to go to university here in the Netherlands, where I have moved since. I felt that my past experiences showed that I thrive and excel when I can use my technical mind to answer exciting questions with the full support of an equally motivated team. 

🎯 Goals: My primary goal for the near future is to learn and develop myself as a data scientist; be part of the machine learning revolution, and bring a feminine touch to this primarily masculine field. 

Follow me on Github --> https://github.com/gyovanaferreira

🌟 Achievements:
►  Founder of the project Alimente-me dedicated to distributing food and other needs to homeless people in Sao Paulo;
►  1st place in the IAESTE Brazil Ranking 2011 for mechanical engineering;  IAESTE provides young science and engineering students globally with paid, course-related work experience.
​
💪 Areas of Expertise:
► Intermediate Python & R
► Entry-level SQL but eager to learn
► Business Analytics & Market Research
► Machine Learning 
► Strong Analytical and Mathematical Skills
► Econometrics Modeling
► Product Development
► Data Science

🛂 EU Citizen | Right to live and work
📧 Do not hesitate to contact me
📍Location: Rotterdam - The Netherlands

Artificial Intelligence | Customer Focus | Machine Learning | Team Player | Data Science | Business Intelligence | Strategy | Innovation | Technology

projects.title: Risk and Returns: The Sharpe Ratio
projects.description:
When you assess whether to invest in an asset, you want to look not only at how much money you could make but also at how much risk you are taking. The Sharpe Ratio, developed by Nobel Prize winner William Sharpe some 50 years ago, does precisely this: it compares the return of an investment to that of an alternative and relates the relative return to the risk of the investment, measured by the standard deviation of returns.

In this project, you will apply the Sharpe ratio to real financial data using pandas.

profile_positions.description:
🌟 Achievements: Reduced the cake segment's cost by 10%, allowing PDV sales to be activated, and raised sales volume by 15% like-for-like.

- Establishing the process for private label DIA category of Bread & Cakes, with over 60 SKUs and an account of 15 Million Er./year, level Brazil.
- Oversees product development of over 20 news SKUs, increasing 5% revenue like-for-like.
- Presents new ideas to corporate executives to increase sales and improve customer relationships.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Alimente-me is a social Project that delivers food, drinks, and hygienic supplies to homeless people in São Paulo.

https://www.facebook.com/projetoalimenteme/

SOS Gestantes aims to bring information to pregnant women in need through lectures with doctors, dentists, lawyers. Newborn clothing was donated in the eighth month for each pregnant woman and a raw food basket monthly.

The SOS Rua project worked with homeless people, children in orphanages, and older people in the asylum. Every month the group gets together to deliver food, clothes, and hygienic supplies to an institution in need.
